item.title: Camera rotates from every mousebutton
item.dc:creator: @my-swagger my-swagger
item.description:
@my-swagger wrote:

I haven’t looked at your code but make sure you’re using the right MouseAdapter that implements the MouseWheelListener interface. That will allow you to use MouseWheelEvent so you use the camera rotation logic when the wheel event is fired.

Quick code example:

[code=java]class Demo implements MouseWheelListener {
…

@Override
public void mouseWheelMoved(MouseWheelEvent e) {
int direction = e.getWheelRotation();
if (direction < 0) {
//Mouse wheel scrolled UP
} else {
//Mouse wheel scrolled DOWN
}
}

…
}[/code]

I’m sure you can work it out from there.

EDIT: I just looked at the code, you’re code should work for scrolling already. What I noticed in mousePressed(MouseEvent) is that your handling mouse wheel stuff on the wrong event? Double check that.
